SEARCH
Package app

Class BlackJack

java.lang.Object
app.BlackJack
public class BlackJack extends Object
BlackJack contains the logic to figure out the winner of the Blackjack game. It is relevant when the BlackJack game mode is chosen in ParadeApp. The BlackJack class works closely with: 1. HumanPlayer: Manages player wagers and bankrolls 2. Server: Handles communication between players 3. MultiplayerController: Controls the game flow in blackjack mode Key features: 1. Manages betting system with minimum and maximum bids 2. Calculates winners based on target score 3. Handles wager collection and distribution 4. Tracks player bankrolls throughout the game

  • Constructor Details

    • BlackJack

      public BlackJack(List<HumanPlayer> humanPLayerList, Server server)
      Creates a new BlackJack game instance.
      Parameters:
      humanPLayerList - List of HumanPlayers participating in this game
      server - Server instance used for communication

  • Method Details

    • collectWagers

      public void collectWagers()
      Collects wagers from all HumanPlayers in the game. Each player's wager must be between MINBID and HumanPlayer's total bankroll. The collected wagers are broadcast to all players.

    • getRoundWinner

      public List<HumanPlayer> getRoundWinner(Map<HumanPlayer,List<Card>> allCollectedCards)
      Determines the winner(s) of the current round based on the collected cards. The winner is the player whose total card value is closest to TARGET_SCORE without exceeding it. In case of a tie, the winnings are split among the winners.
      Parameters:
      allCollectedCards - Map of HumanPlayers to their collected Cards
      Returns:
      List of winning HumanPlayers, or null if all players busted

    • getBlackjackWinner

      public HumanPlayer getBlackjackWinner()
      Determines the overall winner of the BlackJack game. The winner is the HumanPlayer with the highest bankroll.
      Returns:
      The winning HumanPlayer
